archdesc.bioghist: Organization, with headquarters at the University of Michigan, of students and scholars interested in the use of appropriate levels of technology in developing countries. Founded in 1978 as the Association for the Advancement of Appropriate Technology in Developing Countries. In 1979 became the International Association for the Advancement of Appropriate Technology for Developing Countries. In 1984 the name was shortened to International Appropriate Technology Association.
archdesc.scopecontent: Chiefly the association's journal, Approtech; also some membership brochures and pamphlets and a few items relating to the association's University of Michigan chapter.
